content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"> <Esri> <CreaDate>20140811</CreaDate> <CreaTime>13081800</CreaTime> <ArcGISFormat>1.0</ArcGISFormat> <SyncOnce>TRUE</SyncOnce> </Esri> <dataIdInfo> <idAbs>The CD-ROM was compiled according to the methodology developed by the U.S. Geological Survey's World Energy Project . The goal of the project was to assess the undiscovered, technically recoverable oil and gas resources of the world and report these results by the year 2000. A worldwide series of geologic maps, published on CD-ROMs, was released by the U.S. Geological Survey's World Energy Project during 1997 - 2000. Specific details of the data sources and map compilation are given in the metadata files on this CD-ROM. These maps were compiled using Environmental Systems Research Institute Inc. (ESRI) ARC/INFO software. Political boundaries and cartographic representations on this map are shown (with permission) from ESRI's ArcWorld 1:3M digital coverage: they have no political significance and are displayed as general reference only. Portions of this database covering the coastline and country boundaries contain proprietary property of ESRI. (\ufffd\ufffd 1992 and 1996, Environmental Systems Research Institute Inc. All rights reserved.)</idAbs> <searchKeys> <keyword>Geology</keyword> <keyword>Geologic Maps</keyword> <keyword>USGS</keyword> <keyword>U.S. Geological Survey</keyword> <keyword>Earth Science</keyword> <keyword>Africa</keyword> </searchKeys> <idPurp>This map service contains surface geology for the continent of Africa. It is comprised of data and cartography generated and published from USGS Open File Report 97470a. </idPurp> <idCredit>Feliks Persits, Thomas Ahlbrandt, Michele Tuttle, Ronald Charpentier</idCredit> <resConst> <Consts> <useLimit>None</useLimit> </Consts> </resConst> <idCitation> <resTitle>Map services showing geology of Africa </resTitle> </idCitation> </dataIdInfo> <Binary> <Thumbnail> <Data EsriPropertyType="PictureX"></Data> </Thumbnail> </Binary> </metadata>
